data.title: Guide to the Fred S. Keller Papers, 1920
data.meta_description: Fred Simmons Keller (1899-1996) was a psychologist who taught at Columbia University and the University of Brasilia (Brazil). He was awarded a Certificate of Merit in 1948 for his development of "Code Voice", a new technique for teaching Morse Code. He developed, with Dr. J. Gilmour Sherman, Carolina Bori and Rodolpho Azzi, the "Personalized System of Instruction (PSI)" sometimes called the Keller Plan. In 1972 he appeared in a movie with B.F. Skinner called “Together.” The Fred Simmons Keller Papers contain professional correspondence, course notes, speeches, and unpublished papers, mostly concerning educational reform.
